intro: Lomatogonium rotatum, commonly known as the hairy goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite, hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in sandy or rocky soils. Its yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Lomatogonium rotatum is adapted to drought conditions and can thrive with minimal water once established.
